title: Call to artists: St. Luke's Park
description: The City of Ottawa invites artists to submit their qualifications for consideration to design, fabricate and install permanent artwork in St. Luke’s Park in Centretown. The budget for the commission is $55,000 plus HST. Submissions must be received by mail or by hand no later than Monday March 16, 2015 at 5 pm. An information meeting for artists will be held on Wednesday, February 4, 2015 from 6:30 to 8 pm at the Jack Purcell Community Centre, Room 201, 320 Jack Purcell Lane at Elgin Street, Ottawa.

title: RESOLUTION 2015
description: SAW Video’s members are a vital part of the Ottawa–Gatineau media arts community and they are the driving force of our centre. Join us at the Mayfair Theatre as we bring their talent to the big screen with the 2015 edition of RESOLUTION, our annual screening of new members work. This eclectic event showcases Ottawa’s vibrant film making scene with something for everyone, including music videos, drama, documentary, animation and experimental video art. HIGHLIGHTS more information, schedule and synopses, please visit: http://sawvideo.com/event/resolution-2015 DETAILS Resolution 2015 Thursday February 5th 2015, Doors: 6pm / Screening: 6:30pm

title: Denise Levesque: Voyage en Asie
description: La Galerie d’art Eugène–Racette du MIFO vous fait voyager avec l’artiste Denise Levesque. Artiste peintre temps plein depuis sa retraite de l’enseignement des arts en 2009, le style unique de Madame Levesque donne du mouvement, du rythme et de l��motion � ses figures humaines, ses paysages et ses fleurs.L�exposition Asie � c�ur joie comprend une s�rie de tableaux faits � son retour du Tibet, du N�pal et de l�Inde. � Le th�me de l�exposition est celui de la spiritualit� bouddhiste et de l�hindouisme. Les images parlent de m�ditations, d�int�riorisation, de pri�res, de gu�risons, de protections et de partage � explique l�artiste d�Ottawa. Les �uvres sur papier peint � l�acrylique et l�encre de Chine rappelle les tons des paysages d�nud�s du Tibet.Quoi : Denise LevesqueExposition : 2 au 27 f�vrier 2015Vernissage : Le jeudi 5 fevrier 2015, de 19 h a 21 h

title: IFCO PRESENTS: COOL
description: Friday, February 6th at 7 p.m. The Independent Filmmakers Co-operative of Ottawa Inc. (IFCO) invites you to come in out of the cold and enjoy a new batch of Super 8 short films. Ten filmmakers were given 24 hours in which to shoot Super 8mm short films using the theme of COOL. These films will definitely increase your �cool� factor! So bring a friend and drop by for some COOL films!The Independent Filmmakers Co-operative of Ottawa Inc. (IFCO) is a centre for artists who express themselves using the medium of film. IFCO provides its services on a co-operative basis and has supported the creation of over 400 independent Super 8, 16mm or 35mm film productions by its members.IFCO encourages a critical discourse in and historical appreciation of film. It strives to develop and support an innovative and diverse Ottawa-based community of artists. The Co-op continues to occupy a prominent position within the Eastern Ontario arts community.Following the screening, COOL attendees are invited to On the Rocks: Winter in Hokkaido. In 2015, On the Rocks brings you the best in food, drink and art from Northern Japan.Show your COOL pin and enter for � price! LIMITED PINS AVAILABLECall: 613-569-1789Presented by The Independent Filmmakers Co-operative of Ottawa Inc. (IFCO) in partnership with the Downtown Rideau BIA’s CHILL FACTOR.In partnership with Winterlude.

title: On the Rocks: Winter in Hokkaido
description: Every year for Winterlude, Ottawa Art Gallery throws a party to celebrate winter cultures from around the world.In 2015, On the Rocks brings you the best in food, drink and art from Northern Japan.Join us at City Hall on Friday, February 6, from 7:30 to 10:30 pm. Admission is $25 and includes food and drink samples.Advance tickets can be purchased for $20 on OAG's website until Monday February 2 (5 pm).

title: Winterlude in Orléans
description: Frosty weather won’t keep the residents of Orléans from greeting February with gusto. As a partner with Winterlude, the Shenkman Arts Centre will offer a number of events in conjunction with the annual festival. This will be the third year that the Centre has partnered with Winterlude.Fote FrissonsSaturday, February 7, 20158:30 a.m. to 12 noonPresented by Shenkman Arts Centre and sponsored by Minto Communities.This annual family fun mini-fest is our signature Winterlude event! Everything is FREE!This year’s theme is Frozen. Children are welcome to come dressed in their favourite frozen character.* Start the day with a pancake breakfast prepared by Cora’s Breakfast and Lunch Orléans and served up fresh to the first 400 people. * Enjoy performances by Magician Ian Quick, Junkyard Symphony and OYP Theatre School’s presentation of The Ice Princess.* There will also be arts activities, ice carving and snow painting hosted by Ottawa School of Art Orléans.* Also enjoy face painting, Hip Hop demos and more.Additional activities presented in conjunction with Winterlude 2015 include:* Improtine (FR):  Saturday, January 31 at 3 and 5 pm* Peter and the Wolf (SOLD OUT):  Saturday, January 31, 2015 at 4 pm* Stef Paquette (FR):  Saturday, February 7 at 7:30 and 9:30 pm* Michel Louvain (FR) (SOLD OUT):  Saturday, February 14 at 8 pm* Felicity Falls (EN): February 15 and 16, 2015, 1:30 pm and 3:30 pmShenkman Arts )

title: Life’s Simple Pleasures
description: The Orange Art Gallery in Ottawa, Ontario is hosting an exclusive exhibit called "Life's Simple Pleasures". From February 4 to the 22nd, the gallery will be showcasing over 30 figurative sculptures by polymer artist Maria Saracino that celebrate the simplicity and rewards of everyday life. With Valentine's Day landing right in the middle of the exhibit, there will be a collection of works that fall in the "Romance" sub category - after all, romance is one of life's sweetest simple pleasures.Also included in the exhibit is a series of 20 relief sculptures called "Study of Expression". Maria will be doing a demonstration and offering some hands-on mini-workshops on Saturday, February 7th from 1-5 pm.

title: Creative Entrepreneurship & the Maker Movement
description: February 10th - 5:00pm - 7:00pmThroughout the world, millions of engineers, makers, hobbyists, entrepreneurs and innovators are fueling what has been dubbed as the next industrial revolution. With the opening of our very own Makerspace, uOttawa students have access to state-of-the-art and low-cost digital fabrication tools such as 3D printing. Learn how this revolution is poised to unleash an unprecedented new wave of creative entrepreneurs and how you can take advantage. Registration required.

title: Sweetheart Cocktail for the Arts
description: The return of the Sweetheart Cocktail for the Arts brings a warm welcome during this chilly season.It’s a love-in like no other as we celebrate the arts in Ottawa.  The Bridgehead Roastery will provide our toasty location for a fun-filled evening of performance, chat and a superlative silent auction.  You won’t want to miss the treats in store at this signature fundraiser for the Ottawa Arts Council.Tickets are available now, so be sure to book yours today and one for your sweetheart as well.

title: COMMON ALIENS
description: La Petite Mort Gallery presentsCOMMON ALIENS / Group ShowNew Artwork & Mixed Media from the Gallery's ArchivesCurated by Ross McArthurFeaturing Micheal DeForge (Toronto, Canada), Dave Cooper (Ottawa, Canada), Scooter LaForge (New York), Hayden Menzies (Toronto, Canada) & Graham Robinson (Toronto, Canada).February 13 - 28, 2015Vernissage Friday February 13 / 7 - 10pmStatement:To live in a community, as we have all experienced, is an act of optimism. The struggle for human connection is beautiful and strange and important. We are each faced with the common task of reaching out toward one another, defying the isolation of our own minds.Common Aliens brings together a collection of diverse figurative works to populate the gallery with a congregation of familiar strangers; bizarre, vulgar, amplified, deconstructed, careful and arbitrary bodies, not entirely unlike our own and those of the people around us. All the parts of a human are present. We may begin to recognize ourselves in the images, but the connection will always be imperfect. Common Aliens explores and expands that imperfection, inviting a sense of alienation as a tool to investigate the distance between ourselves and the world, and to find comfort in the confusion. - Ross McArthur, 2014

title: Shishya Sadhana
description: Shishya Sadhana 2015Monday February 16th, 2015 (Family Day)  ()6:30 PMTickets 15$As a leading Indian arts institute in Canada, Gharana Arts is proud to present the next generation of aspiring artists in this spectacular dance and musical performance Shishya Sadhana.  Meaning the true devotion of the student, this breathtaking concert will present the melodious music of India and captivate audiences with vivid and descriptive dance dramas. In light of the recent loss to the Indian arts world of Kathak dance legend, Pt. Chitresh Das, this performance will be dedicated to his memory.Featuring the original compositions and choreography from Artists, Kasturi Mishra and Ravi S. K. Singh, highlights of the show include Indian dance and music performances, as well as special Kathak and Tabla arrangements featuring the improvisation of live musicians and dancers on stage.Presented at the Algonquin Commons Theatre (1385 Woodroffe Ave.), this concert promises to be a highlight for the 2015 arts scene in Ottawa. Tickets are $15, and are available at the Algonquin Commons Theatre Box Office.

title: HUB & Spoke & SPIN
description: You are invited to HUB & Spoke, HUB Ottawa's signature networking event, and HUB's first event focusing solely on the arts!On February 19th from 5:30pm to 8pm, join us for a drink and meet artists in Ottawa from all disciplines. Join us in talking about interdisciplinary art initiatives, getting excited about the creative possibilities of interdisciplinary work, and celebrating art initiatives happening across the city of Ottawa. In addition to hearing speakers from various arts organizations, we will feature a giant interactive map of Ottawa's art initiatives, providing artists with opportunities to create connections between their projects and find ways to collaborate with each other. HUB is excited to be partnering with the Undercurrents Festival, capping off the evening by travelling to Arts Court to see "SPIN" at 9pm, an interdisciplinary theatre show by Evalyn Parry. Add your project info to the online invite to include on our Arts in Ottawa map, or just come as an individual to see what's up in Ottawa! Hope you see you February 19th!
